Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i dont think notaries being able to do transparent tx is any special powers, cant think of how they can use it to deanonymize any others, even by a little

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content:
If I understand it correctly the notaries only need t transactions to notarize to the notarization address, if so would it be an idea just to allow transactions to the crypto address. Or is that inpractical?
I agree if the notaries can make t transactions it does not risk the anonymity of others.

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content:
that would also mean the chain does not need to be forked when new notaries are elected.
As I see it PIRATES will not get (can't get) new features so it's a finished product.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: splitting into utxo, being able to receive funds, these are also needed for practical notarization

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i guess one aspect is that a notary could run an exchange and accept t-deposits, but would still need to support z-withdraws

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it doesnt seem like any giant advantage for a notary and I would imagine that anybody that would be running an exchange for PIRATE would be able to get their pubkey added to the exemption list

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content: True I did not think that far that they need to split and actually have funds to notarize üò≥

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it would be possible to require all notaries to mine and create custom coinbase to do the splitting, but this does not seem very practical as it might soon require a z9 to ming the PIRATE treasures
